question: You have a full-time job and you are also doing a part-time evening course.You now find that you cannot continue the course.Write a letter to your teachers. In your letterdescribe the situationexplain why you cannot continue at this timesay what action you would like to takeYou do NOT need to write any addresses.Begin your letter as follows:Dear ................. ,
text: With due respect and humble submission I would like to state that I won't be able to continue the part-time evening course on Language Skills at this time.

Furthermore, I would like to state that I have a full-time job with a software firm and it keeps me busy on weekdays as well as on most of the weekends. Moreover, I am supposed to embark on a travel to England for a period of six months which makes it all the more impossible for me to attend the evening course for the mentioned period. However, I feel that the later half of the year is somewhat free and I would be able to stretch myself and make some time to attend the evening course. Nevertheless, I am planning to spend regularly on picking up the details of the course on my own which will ensure that I might blend in easily when I rejoin the course at a later point in time.
I deeply regret any inconvenience caused to the class as a result of my decision.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase With due respect and humble submission. Consider adding a comma.
The word later doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word make doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
